body:
I could not reproduce this - the file dialog behaves normally on my system whichever way I launch the application, in both Python 2 and 3. I'm pretty sure that Qt is using the native file dialog already, but is there something I can do to ensure this?

Which OS are you using? If the problem is with Qt calling into an OS native dialog, it could well be dependent on the OS. I have Linux with Gnome.

Sorry, I did not put in the OS/X 10.8.5 and 10.9

However, earlier this week, I upgraded PyQt to 4.11.3 and sip 4.16.5, and python 2.7.9.

And now it works, at least with OS/X 10.8.5.

Tomorrow, I will confirm the same with 10.9. If it does work with the above python/PyQt4 versions, I'll close this out.
actually, it does still fail; was re-confirming too late in the night.
@minrk can you take a look on a Mac?

I can reproduce this on:

OS X 10.10.1
Python 3.4.2 (conda)
PyQt 4.10.4
sip 4.15.5

Just ran across a wrinkle in all this. Today I ran across [Using PyQt4 from the Python Shell](http://pyqt.sourceforge.net/Docs/PyQt4/python_shell.html). So, on a whim I tried running as suggest:

```
[1] from PyQt4.QtGui import QApplication
[2] app = QApplication([])
[3] from ipython_nonblock_example import Example
[4] ex = Example()
```

and the file dialog behaved as expected.
I'm dropping this to milestone wishlist, because I don't think it's worth holding up releases for. Anyone on a Mac who wants to have a go at debugging this is welcome to resurrect it.

As @cclan noted [here](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/2380), in inputhookqt4.py, changing
`event_loop.exec_()` to `event_loop.processEvents()` resolves the OS X native modal dialog issues.  I recommend doing this when sys.platform == 'darwin', but not on other platforms.  Details follow...

I spent the afternoon reading through the Qt 5.6 platform adaptation code for OS X / Cocoa and experimenting with LLDB attached to a Python 3.5.1 interpreter running IPython in the terminal with IPython's Qt event hook installed.  The issue is hinted at in the comments appearing in QCocoaFileDialogHelper::exec() and runApplicationModalPanel in qcocoafiledialoghelper.mm:

```
void QCocoaFileDialogHelper::exec()
{
    // Note: If NSApp is not running (which is the case if e.g a top-most
    // QEventLoop has been interrupted, and the second-most event loop has not
    // yet been reactivated (regardless if [NSApp run] is still on the stack)),
    // showing a native modal dialog will fail.
    QMacAutoReleasePool pool;
    if ([mDelegate runApplicationModalPanel])
        emit accept();
    else
        emit reject();
}

- (BOOL)runApplicationModalPanel
{
    QFileInfo info(*mCurrentSelection);
    NSString *filepath = QCFString::toNSString(info.filePath());
    bool selectable = (mOptions->acceptMode() == QFileDialogOptions::AcceptSave)
        || [self panel:nil shouldShowFilename:filepath];

    [mSavePanel setDirectoryURL: [NSURL fileURLWithPath:mCurrentDir]];
    [mSavePanel setNameFieldStringValue:selectable ? QCFString::toNSString(info.fileName()) : @""];

    // Call processEvents in case the event dispatcher has been interrupted, and needs to do
    // cleanup of modal sessions. Do this before showing the native dialog, otherwise it will
    // close down during the cleanup.
    qApp->processEvents(QEventLoop::ExcludeUserInputEvents | QEventLoop::ExcludeSocketNotifiers);
    QCocoaMenuBar::redirectKnownMenuItemsToFirstResponder();
    mReturnCode = [mSavePanel runModal];
    QCocoaMenuBar::resetKnownMenuItemsToQt();

    QAbstractEventDispatcher::instance()->interrupt();
    return (mReturnCode == NSOKButton);
}
```

Neither encapsulates the entirety of the problem, but they start to become informative when comparing the call stack of a waiting modal dialog with `event_loop.exec_()` vs `event_loop.processEvents()` (the former by setting a breakpoint hit before the native modal dialog is erroneously dismissed):

```

#1    0x000000010b275d42 in QDialog::exec() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qdialog.cpp:537
```

Note the presence of `[NSApplication run] ()` in call stack where the hook uses `event_loop.exec_()` and its absence in the stack where the hook uses `event_loop.processEvents()`.

So, let's take a look at exactly what goes wrong when the hook uses event_loop.exec_().

Immediately after native modal dialog construction and before an event is received, the top of the call stack is:

```
#0    0x00007fff8c392386 in mach_msg_trap ()
#1    0x00007fff8c3917c7 in mach_msg ()
#2    0x00007fff96349624 in __CFRunLoopServiceMachPort ()
#3    0x00007fff96348aec in __CFRunLoopRun ()
#4    0x00007fff96348338 in CFRunLoopRunSpecific ()
#5    0x00007fff98c1d935 in RunCurrentEventLoopInMode ()
#6    0x00007fff98c1d76f in ReceiveNextEventCommon ()
#7    0x00007fff98c1d5af in _BlockUntilNextEventMatchingListInModeWithFilter ()
#8    0x00007fff892080ee in _DPSNextEvent ()
#9    0x00007fff895d4943 in -[NSApplication _nextEventMatchingEventMask:untilDate:inMode:dequeue:] ()
#10    0x00007fff893bcd22 in -[NSApplication _realDoModalLoop:peek:] ()
#11    0x00007fff893b92d4 in -[NSApplication runModalForWindow:] ()
#12    0x00007fff89817857 in -[NSSavePanel runModal] ()
#13    0x000000010ee4a176 in -[QNSOpenSavePanelDelegate runApplicationModalPanel] at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/plugins/platforms/cocoa/qcocoafiledialoghelper.mm:239
#14    0x000000010ee4de63 in QCocoaFileDialogHelper::exec() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/plugins/platforms/cocoa/qcocoafiledialoghelper.mm:740
#15    0x000000010b275d42 in QDialog::exec() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qdialog.cpp:537
#16    0x000000010b287619 in QFileDialog::getSaveFileUrl(QWidget*, QString const&, QUrl const&, QString const&, QString*, QFlags<QFileDialog::Option>, QStringList const&) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qfiledialog.cpp:2394
#17    0x000000010b2873d4 in QFileDialog::getSaveFileName(QWidget*, QString const&, QString const&, QString const&, QString*, QFlags<QFileDialog::Option>) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qfiledialog.cpp:2341
```

While we're here, IPython's event hook timer fires, kicking us out of `mach_msg_trap` and all the way back through `[NSSavePanel runModal]`, causing the native modal dialog to close.  Continuing execution until we break on entry into QEventLoop::quit(), the slot called as a result of input hook timer expiration:

```
#0    0x000000010b747934 in QEventLoop::exit(int) [inlined] at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qeventloop.cpp:257
#1    0x000000010b747934 in QEventLoop::quit() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qeventloop.cpp:314
#2    0x000000010b77e46d in QMetaObject::activate(QObject*, int, int, void**) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qobject.cpp:3730
#3    0x000000010b37b9a7 in sipQTimer::timerEvent(QTimerEvent*) ()
#4    0x000000010b777520 in QObject::event(QEvent*) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qobject.cpp:1237
#5    0x000000010b37b937 in sipQTimer::event(QEvent*) ()
#6    0x000000010c624dd6 in QApplicationPrivate::notify_helper(QObject*, QEvent*) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/kernel/qapplication.cpp:3714
#7    0x000000010c627720 in QApplication::notify(QObject*, QEvent*) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/kernel/qapplication.cpp:3157
#8    0x000000010db02a3f in sipQApplication::notify(QObject*, QEvent*) ()
#9    0x000000010b74b2a4 in QCoreApplication::notifyInternal2(QObject*, QEvent*) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qcoreapplication.cpp:1015
#10    0x000000010b7a24c2 in QCoreApplication::sendEvent(QObject*, QEvent*) [inlined] at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/../../include/QtCore/../../src/corelib/kernel/qcoreapplication.h:227
#11    0x000000010b7a24b5 in QTimerInfoList::activateTimers() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/corelib/kernel/qtimerinfo_unix.cpp:637
#12    0x0000000110432fd9 in QCocoaEventDispatcher::processEvents(QFlags<QEventLoop::ProcessEventsFlag>) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/plugins/platforms/cocoa/qcocoaeventdispatcher.mm:491
#13    0x000000011044a160 in -[QNSOpenSavePanelDelegate runApplicationModalPanel] at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/plugins/platforms/cocoa/qcocoafiledialoghelper.mm:237
#14    0x000000011044de63 in QCocoaFileDialogHelper::exec() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/plugins/platforms/cocoa/qcocoafiledialoghelper.mm:740
#15    0x000000010c815d42 in QDialog::exec() at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qdialog.cpp:537
#16    0x000000010c827619 in QFileDialog::getSaveFileUrl(QWidget*, QString const&, QUrl const&, QString const&, QString*, QFlags<QFileDialog::Option>, QStringList const&) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qfiledialog.cpp:2394
#17    0x000000010c8273d4 in QFileDialog::getSaveFileName(QWidget*, QString const&, QString const&, QString const&, QString*, QFlags<QFileDialog::Option>) at /Users/ehvatum/qt5_git/qtbase/src/widgets/dialogs/qfiledialog.cpp:2341
```

As far as I can tell, when the hook uses event_loop.processEvents on OS X, meaning that there is no NSApp run instance in the call stack, Qt places each widget (both modal and non-modal) in its own "modal session" and consumes native events as needed for each, keeping the native widgets happy.  So, this seems like a good workaround for OS X, but I haven't tested it on other platforms, where it's not needed in any case.

Thanks @erikhvatum for digging into it in detail.
